p: ASFV structural proteins involved in virus attachment to permissive cells include p12, p72, and p54 ( 121– 124). ASFV p30 is an early and abundantly expressed phosphoprotein and is necessary for virus internalization ( 124). The pp220 polyprotein is cleaved into 4 major protein components of the viral core, all of which are required for core detachment and release ( 125– 127). The internal envelope protein pE248R is essential for viral fusion with endosomal membranes and core release ( 116, 128).
